title: forge test can't find the contract which is not in the same folder as foundry.toml and test/test.sol
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (58a2729 2023-05-15T00:04:23.550925000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

My contract file is in `/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol`.
My test file is in `/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p/test/contract_t.sol`
In the test file, I import contract file using:
`import "../../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol";`
When i run `forge test`,
I get error:
`Source "blockchain_assets/contracts/p/t.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p".
 --> test/plonk_vk_jellyfish_t.sol:6:1:
  |
6 | import "../../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol";`
But if i use the full path of contract.sol, i won't get this error.

I also checked fs-permission in `/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p/foundry.toml`, 
I have
```
 fs_permissions = [{ access = "read", path = "./"},
{ access = "read", path = "../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/"}]
```
, if I understand it correctly, this should give forge permission to read all files in blockchain_assets/contracts/p.

The problem is that 
when contract sits in  ./nd/blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol, 
test is in ./nd/contract_unit_tests/p/test/contract_t.sol
foundry.toml is in ./nd/contract_unit_tests/p/foundry.toml, 
how can I import contract in the test.sol with relative path?
Thank you!
